body_content.explanation: an agreement in which you pay a company money and they pay your costs if you have an accident, injury, etc.:
examples: I'll need to take out extra car insurance for another driver.
The insurance doesn't cover you for (= include) household items.
When my bike was stolen, I claimed on the insurance.

body_content.explanation: something that protects against the possible damaging effects of something:
examples: Households are stockpiling food as insurance against price rises.
Many people are applying for overseas passports as an insurance policy in case of future chaos.
Owning gold was seen as an insurance against an unknown future.

body_content.explanation: In sport, an insurance run, point, goal, etc. is one that you score when you already have a small lead to make it more difficult for the other team to catch up:
examples: Kelly scored a huge insurance goal to put the Puffins up by 2, with 3 minutes left.
They might regret not being able to score an insurance run in that inning.
